title: How to Make Strawberry Mochi (Daifuku)

steps.headline: Wrap the strawberries in red bean paste and set aside.
Combine the water, mochiko, and sugar until smooth.
Coat a microwave safe container with oil or cooking spray.
Pour the batter in a relatively shallow layer.
Cover with an air-tight lid or plastic wrap and microwave for 7 minutes on High or until done.
steps.description: Alternatively, the dough can be steamed for 15 minutes, as shown in the video below.

steps.headline: Dust your work area or cutting board with mochiko flour.
Pull off a small piece of dough, roll it into a ball, and flatten down.
Take a whole strawberry, put it in the center of the flat piece, and pinch it closed so you have a nice strawberry filled ball.

text: Wrap the strawberries in red bean paste and set aside. (Optional) Combine the water, mochiko, and sugar until smooth.  Coat a microwave safe container with oil or cooking spray.  Pour the batter in a relatively shallow layer.  Cover with an air-tight lid or plastic wrap and microwave for 7 minutes on High or until done. Alternatively, the dough can be steamed for 15 minutes, as shown in the video below. Dust your work area or cutting board with mochiko flour.  Pull off a small piece of dough, roll it into a ball, and flatten down.  Take a whole strawberry, put it in the center of the flat piece, and pinch it closed so you have a nice strawberry filled ball.  Finished.
